bibl.title: Visitors to Elephantine: Who Were They?
bibl.note: Inscriptions and graffiti both in Greek and in Demotic tell us something about the visitors to the temple of Khnûm. From the Ptolemaic to the Roman period, there is an obvious difference in the social class of the temple's customers.

bibl.title: Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond

bibl.seg: MAEHLER Herwig, Visitors to Elephantine: Who Were They?
Janet H. JOHNSON (Ed.), Life in a Multi-Cultural Society: Egypt from Cambyses to Constantine and Beyond = SAOC. 51 (Chicago, 1992) pp. 209-213 et 2 pll.

Inscriptions and graffiti both in Greek and in Demotic tell us something about the visitors to the temple of Khnûm. From the Ptolemaic to the Roman period, there is an obvious difference in the social class of the temple's customers.
